content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, it’s 0-Dark:30, in other words it’s really, really early. Everyone’s asleep, and all through the apartments not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse. That is except for the chick, who turns out to be a rooster and is crowing in the sun. Needless to say, this awakens Monica and Rachel who rush into their living room, searching for the cause of the sound.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What the hell is that?!! (to Monica) What the hell is that? Is that you? (Monica nods her head no, and Rachel realizes what is making that sound.) Ohhhhhhh! (storms over to Chandler and Joey’s with Monica in trail.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Boy, you are really not a morning person.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: BACK OFF!!! (She starts banging on their door.) Get up! Get up! Get up! God damn it! Get up, get up, get up, get up, get up!!
(Chandler opens the door, finally.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is that noise?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s the chick! She’s…going through some changes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What kind of changes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well the vet seems to think that’s she’s becoming a rooster. (The rooster crows.) We’re getting a second opinion.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, it’s later that morning, everybody has gotten up and Ross and Phoebe has joined them for breakfast. Rachel is returning from shopping.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what are you doing shopping at eight in the morning?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’ve been up since six. Thanks to somebody’s dumb-ass rooster.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys you really should get rid of those animals. They shouldn’t be living in an apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Especially not with all of these knives and cookbooks around…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. I’m gonna go to the fertility doctor and um, see if I’m ready to have Frank and Alice’s embryo transferred into my uterus.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now, how will they know if you’re ready?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, they’re just gonna umm, look to see if my endometria layer is thick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I can uh, check that for ya.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay everyone, think thick.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Good-bye! Good luck! (She opens the door to reveal Monica and Joey.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! Wish me luck!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, good luck.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good luck. (to Monica) And I’m still right!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is sooo not true!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s mad because I know today’s her laundry day and that means she’s wearing her old lady underpants.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can check that for ya.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just—I can’t believe that you think that you and Chandler know me and Rachel better than we know you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well… we-we do. You can only eat Tic Tacks in even numbers.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, what’s that about?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you… Ross, I believe, if you check Rachel’s bag you will find a half-eaten box of cookies in there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re good. (Tries a cookie.) These are not.
content.parenthetical: He does so, and finds a half-eaten box of cookies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m so not impressed. Everybody snacks when they shop.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah? Ross, how many items left in that bag?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Five.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, ten bucks says that we can name every item in that bag.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How many guesses do you get?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Six.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Challenge extended.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Deal!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Challenge excepted.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, we’ll start with…apples.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’ll be starting with apples.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop that now!
(Ross reveals a bag of apples.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Uhh, tortilla chips, yogurt.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Diet soda.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. Yes. Yes. (They’re perfect so far.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Orange juice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! There’s no orange juice in there! We win!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ha-ha!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They have another guess.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well, we won that one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, the last thing…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-oh, oh, oh-oh! (Whispers something in Joey’s ear.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, not for like another two weeks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got it! Scotch… tape. (They’re right.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How did you know she would buy scotch tape?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we used there’s up last night making scary faces.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww, man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! Ten buck! Fork it over! Cough it up! Pay the piper! Gimme it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That does not mean you know us better, I-I want a rematch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and none of these stupid grocery questions, real personal questions.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! And the winner gets a hundred bucks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Serious?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you scared?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! All right, who-who makes up the questions?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross will do it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh sure, “Ross will do it!” It’s not like he has a job, or a child, or a life of his own.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine! We’ll ask Phoebe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no, I-I wanna play.

content.description: The Doctor’s office, Dr. Zane is examining Phoebe as Frank and Alice watch.

content.speaker: Dr. Zane
content.text: It looks like your uterus is ready for implantation.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! I knew it! I knew it! I felt really thick this morning.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well, okay, so what’s now—go get, go get the eggs, put ‘em in there.

content.speaker: Dr. Zane
content.text: Okay, it’ll take just a little while to prepare the embryos.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Embryossss? As in, “More than one?”

content.speaker: Dr. Zane
content.text: Um-hmm, five actually.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Five? Okay, where am I giving birth, a hospital or a big box under the stairs?

content.speaker: Dr. Zane
content.text: We do five because that gives you a 25% chance that at least one will attach.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s it! 25 percent? That means that’s it’s like 75 percent chance of no baby at all!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey, y’know I was thinking, what are the odds like if-if, if you stuff like 200 of them in there?

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Sweety, now, she’s a woman, not a gumball machine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well y’know what, don’t worry you guys, ‘cause I’m-I’m gonna do this as many times as it takes to get it right.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well, you see, the-the thing is, we-we only got, we kinda have one shot to make it right.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Umm, it costs $16,000 each time you do this. So, umm, we’re kinda using all the money we have to do it just this one time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa!! That—okay, that’s a lot of pressure on me and my uterus. (to Dr. Zane) So, well okay, so is there—is maybe is there something that I can do y’know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?

content.speaker: Dr. Zane
content.text: No, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! You guys really don’t know anything!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: I know! Why don’t you get drunk! That worked for a lot of girls in my high school.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the game is about to begin.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You guys! Do you realize that any minute now, Phoebe can be pregnant?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know! I know, it’s such a huge, life-altering thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know.
(They all pause and think about it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The test is ready.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! Yes! (They all right into the living room, all excited.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, each team will answer ten questions. The first team that answers the most questions wins. Okay, the categories are, Fears and Pet Peeves, Ancient History, Literature, and It’s All Relative. Now, the coin toss to see who goes first. (He flips the coin and they all watch it hit the table and stop. Then they all look up at him, to see who goes first.) Okay, somebody call it this time.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh yeah!
(Ross flips the coin again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tails!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s heads. (The guys celebrate.) Gentlemen, pick your category.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fears and Pet Peeves.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is Monica’s biggest pet peeve?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Animals dressed as humans.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s correct. Ladies?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Same category?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: According to Chandler, what phenomenon scares the bejeezus out of him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Michael Flatley, Lord of the Dance!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is correct.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Irish gig guy?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: His legs flail about as if independent of his body!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gentlemen, you’re pick.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s All Relative.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica and I have a grandmother who died, you both went to her funeral, name that grandmother!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nana?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She has a real name.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Althea!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Althea?! What are you doing?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I took a shot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you sure it was Althea?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Althea is correct.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice shooting!
(Ross motions for the girls to pick.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’ll take Literature!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Every week, the TV Guide comes to Chandler and Joey’s apartment. What name appears on the address label?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler gets it! It’s Chandler Bing!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m afraid the TV Guide comes to Chinandolor Bong.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I knew that! Rachel! Use you’re head!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually, it’s Miss Chinandolor Bong.

content.description: The Doctor’s office, Phoebe is giving a pep talk to the petrie dish containing the embryos.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello, tiny embryos. Well, I’m-I’m Phoebe Buffay, hi! I’m-I’m-I’m hoping to be your uterus for the next nine months. You should know, that we’re doing this for Frank and Alice, who you know, you’ve been there! Umm, y’know they want you so much, so when you guys get in there, really grab on. Okay, and-and I promise that I’ll keep you safe and warm until you’re ready to have them take you home, so… Oh! And also, umm next time you see me, I’m screaming, don’t worry, that’s what’s supposed to happen.

content.speaker: Dr. Zane
content.text: Ready?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh. (To the embryos) Good luck.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the game is coming to a close.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, the score is nine to eight in favor of the guys. Ladies if you miss this the game is theirs, pick your category.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s All Relative!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t have to shout everything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ooh. What is the name of Chandler’s father’s Las Vegas all-male burlesque?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Viva Las Gaygas!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Unfortunately that is correct.

content.speaker: The Girls
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, we have a tie. Luckily, I have prepared for such an event. (He opens up an envelope and holds up some note cards.) The Lightning Round!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohhhh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thirty seconds, all the questions you can answer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You guys are dead, I am so good at lighting rounds.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I majored in lightning rounds. All right, we’re gonna destroy you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh, wanna bet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m so confused as to what we’ve been doing so far…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How about we play for more money, say 150?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 150 dollars.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Say 200?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 200 dollars.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re doing it again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, I don’t want to lose 200 dollars.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We won’t. (to Chandler) 300?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m just trying to spice it up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, so let’s play for some pepper! Stop spending my money!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I got it! How about, if we win, they have to get rid of the rooster?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oooohh that’s interesting.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, no way, that rooster’s family!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Throw in the duck too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What do you have against the duck?! He doesn’t make any noise!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, he gets the other one all riled up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, we are not gonna…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, hold on! If you win, we give up the birds.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dah!! (Chandler motions for him to calm down.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But if we win, we get your apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oooooh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Deal!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier, only slightly later.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, betting the apartment, I don’t know about this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, I have not missed one question the whole game. I own this game! Look at my hand. (Holds up her hand.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? Do you have the answers written on there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Steady as a rock! Now, are you with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, let’s do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (They go into the living room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, gentlemen, you’re up first.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Starts jumping around.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You have 30 seconds. And the lightning round begins—stop it (Chandler stops jumping)—now. What was Monica’s nickname when she was a field hockey goalie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Big fat goalie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Correct. Rachel claims this is her favorite movie…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dangerous Liaisons .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Correct. Her actual favorite movie is…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Weekend at Bernie’s .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Correct. In what part of her body did Monica get a pencil stuck at age 14?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! (Whispers something in Joey’s ear and then in Ross’s ear.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eww! No!! Her ear! All right, Monica categorizes her towels. How many categories are there?
(They both confer.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Everyday use.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fancy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Guest.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fancy guest.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Two seconds…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, 11!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 11, unbelievable 11 is correct. (The guys celebrate.) All right, that’s 4 for the guys. Ladies, you’re up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on!
(As they change places, they give each other the now patented Ross maneuver. If you don’t know what that means, find out in The One With Joey’s New Girlfriend.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 30 seconds on the clock. 5 questions wins the game. The lightning round begins…now! What is Joey’s favorite food?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sandwiches!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Correct. Chandler was how old when he first touched a girl’s breast?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, had an imaginary childhood friend. His name was?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maurice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Correct, his profession was?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Space cowboy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Correct! What is Chandler Bing’s job?
(The girls are stumped)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh gosh, it has something to do with numbers.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And processing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He carries a briefcase.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 10 seconds, you need this or you lose the game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s umm, it has something to do with transponding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh-oh, he’s a transponce—transpondster!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not even a word! I can get this! I can get this!
(Ross stops the clock, signifying the end of the lightning round.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: YEAH!!! YES!!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler and Joey are carrying in the foosball table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I call Monica’s room!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can’t just call Monica’s room.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure I can, standard shotgun rules, I’m sight of the room and I called it.
(Chandler grunts and turns around, sees that he’s in sight of the room, and mouths damn!)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Man, I feel like I’m coming down with something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. (to Chandler) I bet you can’t guess what color my tonsils are? I’ll bet the apartment!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I would never bet this apartment. It’s too nice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey—ooh Pheebs, are they in there?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, yeah, uh-huh, they’re implanted.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How do you feel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, freaked. ‘Cause it turns out that the odds are really sucky. And! This is Frank and Alice’s like only shot. Like, they are literally putting all of their eggs in my basket.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, but I bet it works.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?! How much?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I’m gonna go take a pregnancy test, right now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh wow! You can tell this soon.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well the doctor says it takes a couple days, but my body’s always been a little faster than Western medicine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! I can’t believe you guys are actually think you’re moving in here!
content.parenthetical: entering from Chandler’s bedroom, I guess, and sees the foosball table.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well believe it baby!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I-I-I’m not moving.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it was a stupid bet! We were just playing a game!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You can’t just ignore the bet! It’s a bet! You bet and you bet and if you lose, you lose the bet!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look Rach, we have to move. I mean if they had lost, we would’ve made them get rid of the birds. Right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noooo.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, look, I hate this as much as you, but if it makes you feel better, it’s all your fault.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chinadolor Bong, come on, we steal that TV Guide every week!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I knew it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t care, I’m not going anywhere.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Cool, girl roommate.
(Phoebe comes in from the bathroom as Rachel sits down in disgust.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nope, not knocked up yet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s only been a couple of hours, so just give it some time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, all right. Meanwhile, I’m gonna do whatever I can to help this so, I’m just gonna y’know, lie it your chair, (She climbs into the chair and drapes her feet over the back of the chair.) Y’know? Yeah, good, I’m let gravity y’know, do its jobs.
[Cut too later, the moving process is progressing steadily. Monica is trying to lift a heavy box, as Rachel comes in from Chandler’s bedroom.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Rach, can you give me a hand with this box?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Put that box down! We are not going anywhere! This is my apartment and I like it! This is a girl’s apartment! That is a boy’s apartment, it’s dirty and it smells. This is pretty. It’s-it’s so pretty! And look, and it’s-it’s purple! And I’m telling you, you with the steady hand, I am not moving, and now I have got the steady hand. (She holds out her hand, which is shaking uncontrollably.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll take care of it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s right! You do what the hand says!
[Cut to later, Phoebe is still in the chair and Rachel is laying down as Monica enters.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How did it go?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I lost our mattresses.
[Cut to still later, Rachel has now resigned herself to move and is now helping Monica. Phoebe is still on the chair.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “ Are you in there little fetus ? In nine will you come great us ? I will buy you some Adidas .”
(There’s a knock on the door and Monica answers it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Frank and Alice
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Hi, Phoebe! We were just at the drugstore and we got you a little present.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Oh.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Umm, it’s a lollipop and a uh, a home pregnancy test.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, don’t mix those up, you could really ruin that lollipop.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: So umm, you feel like taking a test? There’s only one question.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I will. No, I will. But umm, y’know just remember that it’s still really early, okay so, if it says that I’m not pregnant, that doesn’t mean that I’m not gonna get pregnant, okay and, and just please, just so I don’t go completely nuts, just try not put all your hopes on this.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Okay. (They both squeal in expectation.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great. (Goes to take the test.)
(The door opens and Joey and Chandler ride in on the big, fake dog in triumph)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what, you are mean boys, who are just being mean!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, don’t get mad at us! No one forced you to raise the stakes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is not true. She did! She forced me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, we would still be living here if hadn’t gotten the question wrong!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well it stupid, unfair question!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t blame the questions!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you all stop yelling in our apartment! You are ruining moving day for us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Will you stop calling it your apartment!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it is our apartment!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No it’s not!
(They all decay into massive bickering as Phoebe returns from the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys! You guys! You’re gonna have a baby! They’re gonna have a baby!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: MY SISTER’S GONNA HAVE MY BABY!!!!!!!
(They all go over and hug Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, but this can’t be good for the baby.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh! (They stop hugging her to let her out and resume the hug without her.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are busy unpacking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t find garbage bags!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I think I saw some in here.
(She opens a door and they both scream at horror at what’s inside of it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know! But maybe if we keep that drawer shut, it’ll die.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe we’re living here!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, they’re both unpacked. The big ceramic dog has found a new home in front of the window. Joey screams and runs into the living room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?! What-what is it?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did you see the size of the closets?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe we live here!
(They both sit down on the chairs and put up the foot rest.)

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Awwwww!! (They lean back all the way.) Awwwwwww!!!
